reviews.review: The Russo brothers have somehow accomplished the impossible and made this not only work but made it into a masterpiece of the comic book genre. It will make you cheer, it will make you laugh, it will make you cry. This is more than just a movie, it's an experience.
it was amazing and everything I've ever wanted but destroyed me completely, I hate marvel so much why
Wonderful movie, left me craving for more!

As a Marvel fan since the start of the franchise (including the Hulk movie), this movie is not just the start of the final showdown of a 10-year arch, but it is also a love letter to the Marvel comics, to Marvel fans, and movie making. I can only imagine how hard would it be to go to this movie and have not been in the Marvel train for at least 5 to 6 years, but it is also quite fulfilling for those who were on this immense journey, to be presented with this prize, this incredible milestone that is Infinity War. It is this bookend for a plethora of characters and stories, told many different people, and now culminates in a massive conclusion. This is not a carbon copy of the comics, neither it is an attempt to be. It is another tale of Thanos, the Avengers, the Infinity Stones, and the fate of half of the universe. This movie does not hold the hands of newcomers, and it doesn't have to. This is the award for the commitment of the filmmakers, the actors, and those who followed this journey. I loved it, it makes me happy as a movie lover, a comics reader, and as a person.
could have started better but overall a solid film

NOT gonna lie but there wasn't really a storyline here it was fight scene after fight scen there were some really funny parts I loved the parts between the guardians of the galaxy and Thor it was the perfect fit but the ending was SHIT I NEVER HATED AN ENDING MORE I ALMOST STARTED CRYING

Beautiful, breathtaking, a masterpiece in every sense. The Russo Brothers and Kevin Feige have solidified themselves as the best directors and producer in the game. This film is why we go to the movies.
This movie is like the visual equivalent of waiting at a bus stop.
An absolutely EPIC film. One that people will be talking about for years.
Grew up with the series and I loved this
